channel.title: Dailies on Nathan Borror
channel.description: Recent content in Dailies on Nathan Borror

item.description: Saturday, June 5, 2021 ☕️ Highwire at home 📖 Although Of Course You End Up Becoming Yourself 🏃‍♂️ 9 to Putah Creek and back 🥙 Three Ladies Cafe ☕️ Pachamama Thursday, May 13, 2021 ☕️ Higher Land at home 📖 Think Again 🎧 2016 Interview between Kara Swisher and Antonio García-Martinez Missing the days when expressing some opinions didn’t feel worrisome — expressing opinions as a means to learn or grow in the absence of judgement.

Thursday, December 31, 2020 ☕️ Highwire on Solano 🍕 Cheeseboard run for tonight ☕️ Wrecking Ball on Shattuck Easy day in Berkeley. Got a bunch of food for tonight and hung some posters for our missing runner friend, Lucas. Researched some zero degree bags for some potential winter adventures. 🏃‍♂️ Campus out-and-back six Wednesday, December 30, 2020 ☕️ Temple at home ☕️ Andytown on Tarval 🚶‍♂️ Long Outer Sunset walk Drove to San Francisco to get a COVID test so we can spend some time with Nate’s mom over New Years.

Saturday, March 31, 2018 Weekend alone begins at Flywheel. Ran into Justin Stahl whom I hadn’t seen in years ☕️💻 Playing around with data portability. I’ve given up trying to use iCloud Drive, it works but introduces a host of concerns I don’t want to deal with for these little tools. Instead I’m making it easy to import / export data. Fun side effect is it makes peer-to-peer sharing really easy.

Sunday, December 31, 2017 ☕️ Andytown with Jess ☕️ Algorithm Coffee in Berkeley Playing with “flash messages” which was something the Django Admin had as a feedback mechanism. Building something similar for iOS. Friday, December 29, 2017 ☕️ Espresso at home 🏃 Park four 🥪 Clubber from Blue Barn ☕️ Hacking from Equator in Fort Mason 🌅 Wandered around Fort Mason Made a menu bar app to report deploy statuses so I don’t have to keep Slack open all the time.
